intro: Scorpioides muricata, commonly known as the rough scorpion plant, is a member of the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking, spiny leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers, which are usually red or orange, are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Scorpioides muricata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in well-drained soils with partial to full sun.
